question.text: An explosion blows a rock into three parts. Two parts go off at right angles to each other. These two are, $1 \mathrm{~kg}$ first part moving with a velocity of $12 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}$ and $2 \mathrm{~kg}$ second part moving with a velocity of $8 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}$. If the third part flies off with a velocity of $4 \mathrm{~ms}^{-1}$, its mass would be
